title: Wembanyama bids adieu to France with a defeat as the teen prodigy prepares for NBA career
description: The French player's performance couldn't prevent his Boulogne-Levallois team losing 92-85 to Monaco in a must-win Game 3 in the best-of-five French league championship series on Thursday.

title: Finland to get right-wing government with far-right
description: The Finnish Prime Minister-designate Petteri Orpo said Thursday a four-party coalition including the far-right Finns Party had agreed to form a government. The negotiations proved to be challenging on the topics of development aid, immigration, and the climate.

title: Ukraine judge convicted of corruption against backdrop of political factions battle
description: At the end of a seven-year political and judicial imbroglio fueled by the rivalry between the last two Ukrainian presidents, the magistrate Mykola Tchaouss was kidnapped in Moldavia by Ukrainian services, before being put on trial.

title: 9 survivors arrested as hope fades for migrants aboard boat that sank near Greece
description: The coast guard said late Thursday that it had arrested nine people on suspicion of belonging to the smuggling ring that arranged the voyage. State-run ERT TV said the suspects were all Egyptians, adding that the ship originally left an Egyptian port for the area of Tobruk in eastern Libya.

title: US Supreme Court upholds Native American adoption law
description: The law holds that Native children taken from their families and put up for adoption should be kept within their tribes. Native American tribes have hailed the decision as a major victory.

title: Bernard Phelan recounts eight months of captivity in Iran’s 'Satan’s block'
description: Arrested in Mashhad in October last year during major anti-regime protests, Bernard Phelan was one of seven French hostages in Iran. He spoke to Le Monde in an exclusive account from imprisonment to his release last month.

title: EU warns that Chinese tech giant Huawei poses security risk
description: The European Commission said that it will no longer use services connected to the Chinese companies Huawei and ZTE because of security risks.

title: A million people displaced in DRC so far this year
description: The International Organization for Migration said on Thursday that as the humanitarian situation in the country worsens, more and more people are fleeing their homes.

title: ECB hikes rates to 22-year high and vows to keep going
description: While the US Federal Reserve is hitting pause on a series on interest rate hikes, the ECB has once again raised rates and says that more are on the way.

title: World breaks average temperature record for early June
description: The EU's climate monitoring service registered the highest temperatures in early June on record.

title: The many faces of Sudan's General Hemedti, a 'son of the desert'
description: The head of the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) presents himself as the defender of 'marginalized' people against the military and political elites who have governed the country since its independence.

title: Depardieu to sell art collection worth millions
description: The French actor plans to sell a large number of paintings and statues. He is currently the subject of a rape investigation and recent accusations of sexual misconduct.

title: Macron wants French AI models to compete with OpenAI and Google
description: At the VivaTech trade show, the French president said he shared 'concerns' that European plans to regulate artificial intelligence would harm innovation.

title: Sandro Veronesi: 'In the depths of my heart, I felt pain at the news of Silvio Berlusconi's death'
description: One of the most important authors of contemporary Italian literature, Veronesi shares the distress he felt learning of the Cavaliere's death, recognizing in him a man devoid of shame, driven by impulses we all experience.

title: Palais de Tokyo and Beaux-Arts de Paris await renovations
description: A number of contemporary art venues housed in historic buildings are scheduled for renovation over the next few years.

title: Hellish Paris rush hour highlights transport problems one year before 2024 Olympics
description: Hundreds of people were trapped in the tunnels of metro line 4 on Wednesday evening, under hot, stressful conditions. The whole of line 13 was also down for a prolonged period.

title: Christophe Leribault, president of the Musée d'Orsay: 'We need to make our collections much more intelligible'
description: Musée d'Orsay president Christophe Leribault explained the reasons behind the major renovation planned for the Paris museum.

title: Glenda Jackson, two-time Oscar-winning actress, dies at 87
description: Her agent said the actress and MP died at her home on Thursday, June 15 after a 'brief illness.'

title: Migrant boat capsizes off Greek coast in deadliest accident since 2016
description: A fishing vessel that left from Libya sank on the night of June 13, as it attempted to reach Italy. Over 100 people were rescued but survivors said the boat was carrying 750 passengers.

title: Israel refuses to release Palestinian prisoner with terminal cancer
description: Convicted of belonging to a cell that killed an Israeli soldier, the writer Walid Daqqa, 62, has already spent 37 years of his life in prison.

title: Boris Johnson deliberately misled MPs over 'partygate' during Covid lockdown, finds report
description: After a year-long investigation, the former British prime minister was found to have deliberately misled Parliament about the lockdown-flouting parties that undermined his credibility and contributed to his downfall.

title: Jean-Michel Aulas: 'Give female footballers the exposure they deserve and the stadium attendance they dream of'
description: The French Football Federation has just struck agreements with broadcasters over the TV rights for the World Cup, the national team, and Division 1. The former president of Olympique Lyonnais took part in the negotiations.

title: Lebanon: Stalemate over presidential election intensifies
description: For the 12th time, Lebanese MPs failed to fill the post of president, vacant since Michel Aoun's term expired at the end of October 2022.

title: Investigation: French police are trained to use Cougar grenade launchers dangerously
description: Le Monde obtained internal training documents used by the French national police. They reveal how officers are trained to carry out dangerous shots, in breach of design standards, and within a problematic legal framework.

title: Another abortion rights demonstration held in Warsaw after woman dies
description: Though Dorota's condition was serious, nursing staff gave her family hope for the future. There have been at least six victims since the tightening of the abortion law came into effect in 2021.

title: As France bans HHC cannabis alternative, stores rush to sell off stock
description: The synthetic derivative of cannabis has just been classified as a drug and banned. Store owners in Paris are not happy with the decision.

title: Subsidy war threatens European unity
description: The Covid-19 pandemic, the war in Ukraine, and Chinese and American protectionism provoked a torrent of state aid in the European Union. Rules on subsidies are loosening, triggering conflicts between countries.

title: Wave of far-right violence in Brittany worries elected officials
description: Over the past few months, far-right militants have been stepping up violence. Brittany's political leaders are unsettled and are struggling to react.

title: Guatemala newspaper founder sentenced to six years in jail
description: Rights groups warn the country is about to extinguish press freedoms, as it gets ready for presidential election later this month.

title: Sudanese army accuses paramilitary of killing West Darfur governor
description: The country has been engulfed in a two-month-long civil war.

title: Who is Krystian Lupa, whose play was cancelled at the Avignon Festival?
description: The 79-year-old Polish director, renowned for his trailblazing creations, was one of the star guests at the Avignon Festival. But his show will not be performed there after all.

title: Australia wants to stop Russia from building embassy near Parliament House
description: The country's Prime Minister announced the decision on Thursday, citing "threats to national security".
